channel.title: sitespeed.io release feed
channel.description: New releases and changelog feed of sitespeed.io
channel.copyright: All rights reserved 2022, Peter Hedenskog and team

item.title: sitespeed.io 36.0.2
item.description:
Fixed

  • Updated Browsertime with a fix if the Jimp dependency is missing.

item.title: sitespeed.io 36.0.1
item.description:
Fixed

  • Disable the CPU/enableProfileRun check introduced in 36.0.0, that affected too many users #4408.

item.title: sitespeed.io 36.0.0
item.description:
Added

  • Update to Coach-core 8.1.1 #4363
  • Use the offical Slack plugin instead of node-slack #4360.
  • Firefox 134, Chrome 132 and NodeJS 22 in the Docker container #4395, #4396 and #4405
  • Let the Docker container output the CPU architecture for easier error reporting #4404.

Fixed

  • Replace dependencies with local code:
  • Fix cli command: Use --summaryDetail (not summary-detail) #4376.
  • Remove connectivity output from text since it was broken #4375.
  • Upgrade to co2.js 0.16.4 #4353.
  • Make sure co2 data is only read once at startup #4352.
  • Making the slim container a little smaller #4355.
  • Ugrade to google-cloud/storage-7.14.0 #4361.
  • Upgrade to AWS client 3.717.0 #4368
  • Removed the webdriver manager in the Docker container 4390. We don't use it but on MacOS Selenium still uses it to find the driver for Safari so we can only remove it in Docker.
  • Fix Wilcoxon NaN values when running the compare plugin #4402.

item.title: browsertime 24.0.1
item.description:
Fixed

  • If Jimp is missing when storing an image, log and write the file as PNG #2257.

item.title: browsertime 24.0.0
item.description:
Added

  • Edgedriver 132 #2236.
  • Chromedriver 132 #2236.
  • Chrome and Edge 132, Firefox 134 in the Docker container + NodeJS 22 #2255.

Fixed

  • Replace dependencies with local implementation:
  • Fix Docker file ENV to follow the new standard #2239.

Changed

  • Moved usb-power-profiling to be an optional package #2249.

item.title: coach-core 8.1.1
item.description:
Fixed

  • Fix broken minified release.

item.title: coach-core 8.1.0
item.description:
Added

  • Use latest data from https://github.com/enthec/webappanalyzer #114.
  • Use third part web 0.26.2 #113

Fixed

  • Update dev dependencies #115, #116 and #117.

item.title: sitespeed.io 35.7.5
item.description:
Fixed

  • Update to faststat 0.0.7 #4347.
  • Update dev dependencies #4345.
  • Let analysisstorer know about webpagereplay so that correct information is displayed #4349.
  • Pass on webpagereplay flag to browsertime #4350.
  • Update to Browsertime 23.5.0 #4351

item.title: browsertime 23.5.0
item.description:
Added

  • Added --userTimingBlockList #2227.

Fixed

  • Updated to webdriver 4.28 #2226.
  • Updated dev dependencies #2228.
  • Fix so the check for gnirehtet always use --android.gnirehtet to fix problems setting it in sitespeed.io #2229.
  • Update to execa 9.5.2 #2231.
  • Update to adbkit 3.3.8 #2232.
  • Fix so you cannot use gnirehtet with webpagereplay #2230.

item.title: sitespeed.io 35.7.4
item.description:
Fixed

  • Updated to Browsertime 23.4.5 that have a fix for visual metrics running videos from mobile #4343.

item.title: browsertime 23.4.5
item.description:
Fixed

  • Change bottom margin from 10 to 14 pixel when recording a video on mobile, se bug #2224 and PR #2225.

item.title: sitespeed.io 35.7.3
item.description:
Fixed

  • Add validation for dataset lengths for the Wilcoxon test. Thank you Pavel Bairov for PR 4341.
  • Updated to Browsertime 23.4.4 that has a more robust check for gnirehtet configuration #4342.

item.title: browsertime 23.4.4
item.description:
Fixed

  • A more robust gnirehtet check when you run your Android test #2223.

item.title: testrunner 1.0.3
item.description:
Fixed

  • Fix killing WebPageReplay correctly and correct path to WebPageReplay files #108.

item.title: testrunner 1.0.2
item.description:
Fixed

  • Fix broken path to the WebPageReplay script when running as npm package and fix so you also can run desktop test using WebPageReplay when you use npm #107.

item.title: sitespeed.io 35.7.2
item.description:
Fixed

  • Added extra logs if the compare plugin fails when using Python so we easily can see the input parameters.

item.title: sitespeed.io 35.7.1
item.description:
Fixed

  • Updated to Browsertime 23.4.3 #4336.
  • Make sure Firefox displays power consumption in mWH #4334.

item.title: browsertime 23.4.3
item.description:
Fixed

  • Update to USB power profiling 1.5.0 #2221.

item.title: browsertime 23.4.2
item.description:
Fixed

  • Improve how we compute the power consumption numbers from the Firefox Profiler output PR by Nazım Can Altınova #2220

item.title: testrunner 1.0.1
item.description:
Fixed

  • Fixed the release flow so the Docker containers get the correct tag.

item.title: testrunner 1.0.0
item.description:
Added

  • A new Docker setup #95

item.title: server 1.0.1
item.description:
Fixed

  • Fixed the release flow so the Docker containers get the correct tag.

item.title: server 1.0.0
item.description:
Added

  • A new Docker setup #95

item.title: sitespeed.io 35.7.0
item.description:
Added

  • Firefox 133 in the Docker container #4327.

Fixed

  • Axe Core 4.10.2 #3328
  • Fix security warnings in the Docker container.

item.title: sitespeed.io 35.6.1
item.description:
Fixed

  • Make sure the compare plugin can handle if your run Firefox with CPU options #4324.

item.title: browsertime 23.4.1
item.description:
Fixed

  • Cleanup of the extra timings that is added to the timeline for Chrome #2218

item.title: browsertime 23.4.0
item.description:
Added

  • Collect more information about the largest contentful paint #2206
  • Add extra timings and new custom timeline to the Chrome timeline #2217. Inspired by [

Fixed

  • More configuration tuning for Firefox #2216.

item.title: browsertime 23.3.3
item.description:
Fixed

  • Disable search suggestion requests for Firefox #2215
  • Fix for including HTTP requests in the Firefox profile #2214.
  • Fix when running --enableProfileRun and get visual metrics. It used to generate an error log, this fixes that #2213.

item.title: chrome-har 1.0.1
item.description:
Fixed

  • Try/catch broken dates #130.

item.title: chrome-har 1.0.0
item.description:
Fixed

  • Removed dayjs dependency #128.
  • Removed uuid dependency #127.
  • Updated to tough cookie 5.0.0 #126.

item.title: testrunner 0.5.6
item.description:
Fixed

  • Bull 4.16.3 #87

item.title: server 0.4.5
item.description:
Fixed

  • Express 5.0.0 #86.
  • Update body parser #88.
  • Bull 4.16.3 #87

item.title: server 0.4.2
item.description:
Fixed

  • Device id was broken in the front end #80 and #81.
  • The internal configuration was broken in the way that removing/adding testrunners failed removing correct configurations #84. This fix also needs #83 in the testrunners.

item.title: throttle 5.0.1
item.description:
Fixed

  • Smarter ifb0 handling on Linux #93.

item.title: server 0.4.1
item.description:
Fixed

  • Fix bug so you can choose emulated mobile in GUI #76.

item.title: testrunner 0.5.3
item.description:
Fixed

  • Correctly set the hostname in the configuration file #83.

item.title: testrunner 0.5.2
item.description:
Fixed

  • Fix a bug setting the baseline for compare plugin #71.

item.title: testrunner 0.5.1
item.description:
Fixed

  • Correct version in package.json

item.title: testrunner 0.5.0
item.description:
Added

  • When running compare plugin tests using Docker, set the baseline directory automatically #70
    • Make it possible to choose container that runs the test, using the API #69

item.title: server 0.4.0
item.description:
Added

  • Merged slug/label column in search result #68
  • Make it possible to choose container that runs the test, using the API #69

item.title: testrunner 0.4.1
item.description:
Fixed

  • Log testrunner version on startup #67.

item.title: server 0.3.2
item.description:
Fixed

  • Upgrade to Bull 4.15.1 #57.
  • Default to max 50 finished jobs in the queue #58.
  • Update dev dependencies like ESLint 9 #62.
  • Update DayJS 1.11.11 #63
  • Make sure all uncaught errors are caught #64
  • Add a keydb configuration file #56

item.title: chrome-har 0.13.5
item.description:
Fixed

  • Always take care of Network.responseReceivedExtraInfo even if its fired early, thank you ifduyue for PR #120.

item.title: chrome-har 0.13.3
item.description:
Fixed

  • Include early hints requests, thank you Ben Schwarz for PR #118.

item.title: server 0.3.1
item.description:
Fixed

  • If the queue system is down when you add a new test, make sure the status of the test in the database is failed #50.
  • If the queue is not up when you access the start page, make sure that at least after X seconds you get a error page #53.

item.title: server 0.3.0
item.description:
Added

  • search: Make label configurable in search result #46.
  • search: Make run date readable #45.
  • Show version number in footer and API #44.

item.title: server 0.2.1
item.description:
Fixed

  • Search: Fix for searching for test type #42.

item.title: coach-core 8.0.2
item.description:
Fixed

  • Another update to PageXray with a safer HTTP header check.

item.title: coach-core 8.0.1
item.description:
Fixed

  • Updated PageXray.

item.title: pagexray 4.4.4
item.description:
Fixed

  • Added a safer header check #125.

item.title: pagexray 4.4.3
item.description:
Fixed

  • If the meta section from a HAR file from Browsertime was missing, we didn't catch that. Fixed in #124.
  • Update to latest minimist #122.

item.title: coach-core 8.0.0
item.description:
Added

  • Expose third party web and wappalyzer versions #111.

Fixed

  • Updated to Wappalyzer 6.10.66 #110.
  • Updated third party web 0.24.0 #108.
  • Fix correct LCP attribute #107.

Changed

  • Remove advice about disableFLoCHeader #106.

item.title: chrome-har 0.13.2
item.description:
Fixed

  • Updated tough-cookie, thank you lallenlowe for PR #107.

item.title: coach-core 7.2.1
item.description:
Fixed

  • Catch if local storage or session storage isn't accessible.

item.title: coach-core 7.2.0
item.description:
Added

  • Upgraded to third party web 0.23.0. #98.
  • Upgraded to latest wappalyzer #100.

Fixed

  • Make sure to skip advice if Chrome is missing FCP #95.
  • Update dev dependencies

item.title: chrome-har 0.13.1
item.description:
Fixed

  • Updated dependencies to latest versions #105.
  • Remove adding headers from extra parameters. Using the CDP Fetch API manipulating responses, the extra response info holds the old un-manipulated headers, so when copying the ones that do not exist, this breaks. Fixed in #100.

item.title: coach-core 7.1.3
item.description:
Fixed

  • Fixed exporting to work with ESM modules too.

item.title: throttle 5.0.0
item.description:
Changed

  • Dropped support for NodeJS 12 since it's unmaintaned.

item.title: throttle 4.0.3
item.description:
Fixed

  • Fixed --version so it actually shows the version again #75.

item.title: throttle 4.0.2
item.description:
Fixed

  • The E6 Module convertion in 4.0 broke version check (--version) making installs failed. PR #74 is a temporaty fix for that.

item.title: throttle 4.0.1
item.description:
Fixed

  • Removed the dependecy of route. Using ip route instead and we already have ip as a requirement.

item.title: coach-core 7.1.2
item.description:
Fixed

  • Upgraded to PageXray 4.4.2 and Third Party Web 0.17.1.

item.title: pagexray 4.4.2
item.description:
Fixed

  • Added missing SSL timings to the time per domain #117

item.title: throttle 3.1.1
item.description:
Fixed

  • Updated minimist dependency.

item.title: throttle 4.0.0
item.description:
Fixed

  • Updated dev dependencies to latest versions #68

Changed

  • Converting the project to ES6 module. If you run Throttle by command line it will work exactly as before except that we dropped support for NodeJS 10 #67. You can read Sindre Sorhus ESM package guide.

item.title: coach-core 7.1.1
item.description:
Fixed

  • Upgraded to PageXray 4.4.1 and Third Party Web 0.15.0.

item.title: pagexray 4.4.1
item.description:
Fixed

  • Bumped minimist to 1.2.6

item.title: pagexray 4.4.0
item.description:
Added

  • Fallback if mime types aren't mapped and use file endings. At the moment we fallback for some of the font types #109.

item.title: chrome-har 0.13.0
item.description:
Added

  • Add _isLinkPreload on the request object if it is isLinkPreload #94.

item.title: throttle 3.1.0
item.description:
Added

  • Add support for setting packet loss. Add --packetLoss and set the loss in percentage.

item.title: coach 7.0.0
item.description:
Added

  • Updated to use latest Coach core and Browertime.

item.title: coach 6.4.3
item.description:
Added

  • Updated to use latest Browsertime with latest Chromedriver
  • Updated Docker container to use latest Chrome/Firefox
  • Use Browsertime 11.0.0
  • Use Coach-code 6.0
  • Use latest Firefox and Chrome

item.title: throttle 3.0.0
item.description:
Changed

  • When you run on Mac OS we changed so localhost traffic is not throttled by default. To throttle on localhost use --localhost. This makes sence if you use WebDriver to drive your browser on your local machine. And Mac OS now works the same as Linux.

item.title: throttle 2.1.2
item.description:
Fixed

  • Fix breakage when multiple default routes are declared , thank you Andy Richardson for PR #62.

item.title: pagexray 4.3.1
item.description:
Added

  • Added missing in_body_parser_blocking render blocking info for Chrome.

item.title: pagexray 4.3.0
item.description:
Added

  • Include request method per asset #105.

item.title: pagexray 4.2.0
item.description:
Added

  • Attach info about render blocking assets coming/working in Chrome 92 #104.

item.title: pagexray 4.1.0
item.description:
Added

  • Attach Google Web Vitals data from Browsertime #101.

item.title: pagexray 4.0.0
item.description:
Changed

  • The new header structure actually sucked. Instead follow other tools and flatten headers returning an array #98.

item.title: chrome-har 0.11.12
item.description:
Fixed

  • Removed test directory from the release, thank you Yury Michurin for the PR #75.

item.title: coach 5.0.0
item.description:
Changed

  • We moved out the core functionality to coach-core. This makes it easy to use the Coach in your own code.

item.title: coach 4.4.1
item.description:
Fixed

  • Upgraded to Browsertime 8.0.1

item.title: humble 0.2.0
item.description:
Added

  • Updated throttle frontend to latest version where you can see throttling profiles set by using the API and with custom throttling support.

item.title: compare 1.0.0
item.description:
Added

  • Added support for using Github gists see #34.
  • Added support for using a config file to configure which HARs to test.
  • Added support for copy/paste directly you HAR, configuration file or a gist URL or id.
  • Refactor the CSS into Sass, development build process now uses BrowserSync.
  • Service worker added for offline support. Workbox is used to achieve this.
  • Added support for showing changes in request/responses if you compare the same page #63.

Changed

  • New internal structure and use the new configuration object all the way.

item.title: compare 0.6.0
item.description:
Added

  • Sort CPU events by name to make it easier to spot regressions
  • Upgraded to latest release of template7
  • Added more Visual Metrics.
  • Upgrad to PageXray 2.4.0

item.title: compare 0.5.1
item.description:
Fixed

  • Layout -> Rendering in latest Browsertime.
  • Upgraded to PerfCascade 2.5.2 fixiing Edge tab bug

item.title: compare 0.5.0
item.description:
Added

  • CPU metrics are now showed automatically.
  • Styled the PageXray info table to make it easier to read.

item.title: compare 0.4.1
item.description:
Fixed

  • Major code refactoring to make it easier to do changes in the future.
  • Uploading files failed on Firefox.

item.title: compare 0.4.0
item.description:
Added

  • Upgraded to PerfCascade 2.4.1
  • You can change/upload HAR files when you already compare two HARs.

Fixed

  • The layout in the PageXray table was dependent of the length of the URL. That could make some pages look really bad.

item.title: compare 0.3.0
item.description:
Added

  • Automatically load the HAR files if both files are given in the URL . Thanks Ivru for the PR #15.
  • You can automatically load one HAR file by adding ?har1=URL&compare=1 as the full URL.
  • Updated to PageXray 2.2.1
  • You can now drag and drop one HAR file with multiple pages and compare the pages with each others #16.

item.title: compare 0.2.1
item.description:
Fixed

  • Upgraded to PerfCascade 2.2.2 that makes HAR files from WebPageTest Linux render
  • Log errors to the console

item.title: compare 0.2.0
item.description:
Added

  • Upgraded to PageXray 2.1.0 and added more CPU metrics
